message: “We all say that if we were alive at the time of the Civil War, we’d be abolitionists, we’d fight slavery and help slaves run to freedom, but the sad fact is there are more slaves in the world now than there were during the Civil War,”

data.description: Plymouth Church in Brooklyn is building on its rich abolitionist history by aiming to end human trafficking, a form of modern slavery.
data.title: Survivors, advocates shed light on city’s lucrative human trafficking trade
